titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Andre M. Rossfelder collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Josh Giglio

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-21T16:09-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Reports, bulletins, and letters, relating to the Algerian revolution and civil war, and especially to atrocities in Algeria. Includes many official informational bulletins of the French government in Algeria

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Andre M. Rossfelder collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1998.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: André M. Rossfelder Papers, MSS-S 112. Special Collections and Archives, UC San Diego.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Reports, bulletins, and letters, relating to the Algerian revolution and civil war, and especially to atrocities in Algeria. Includes many official informational bulletins of the French government in Algeria

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports documenting a time of the growing Muslim rebellion and the implementations of General Charles de Gaulle. Includes integration and assimilation talks and actions of the Algerian National Liberation Front as well as their combatant force, the National Liberation Army. Reports also include information on talks with the United Nations in response to the growing discontent in the region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar reports to the aforementioned French-Algerian Reports, these reports focus more on the political consequences surrounding suspected Algerian collaboration with Communism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Algerian administrative reports pertaining to the renovation of Algerian institutions, education, and social policy, including the transformation of infrastructure, industrialization, and the plan in Constantine.
